thread.title: Acting up in paradise set for film
thread.title_full: Acting up in paradise set for film

title: Acting up in paradise set for film
text:
Aussie comedian and actor Stephen Curry praises FNQ by: BIG KIDS: Matt Hearn pushes Stephen Curry and Arlo Curry, 3, Tennyson Hearn, 3, and Beau Curry, 1, after the families arrive at Cairns Airport. PICTURE: JUSTIN BRIERTY Source: News Limited 
AUSSIE funny man Stephen Curry has dubbed Far North Queensland a filmmaker’s paradise. 
The award-winning actor yesterday arrived in the region ahead of this weekend’s Port Shorts Film Festival at Port Douglas, where he and renowned producer Matt Hearn will mentor the next generation of filmmaking talent. 
Curry, who has featured in Aussie classics such as The Castle and Rogue , said the Far North was a “whole new world” for storytellers. 
“Cairns and Far North Queensland is such a world away from what people know,” he said. 
“It’s a point of creativity and there are so many stories to be told. 
“The landscape is also incredible, it’s God’s country.” 
Hearn, who produced the 2005 cult thriller Wolf Creek , said short-film festivals such as Port Shorts provided the perfect avenue for finding new talent. 
“Everyone I know in the industry has experimented with short films,” he said. 
“You’ve got to learn how to build a narrative and short film is the best path to doing that.” 
A total of 111 short films were received for the event, which celebrates the industry’s rising talent. 
The winners of the Open and Local Filmmaking sections will be announced at a special outdoor screening tonight.
